content: British judge **Sir Robert Roger Peel** (born 29 January 1966) is a British [High Court judge](/wiki/High_Court_judge_(England_and_Wales)). He is National Lead Judge of the Financial Remedies Court, the court which deals with assets on divorce. Peel was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and spent a portion of his childhood in Africa, being educated at [private schools](/wiki/Private_schools_in_the_United_Kingdom) in England. He studied at [Brasenose College, Oxford](/wiki/Brasenose_College,_Oxford) where he completed a [BA](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts) in modern languages, studying French and Spanish. He then completed a [diploma in law](/wiki/Graduate_Diploma_in_Law) at [City University London](/wiki/City,_University_of_London). He was [called to the bar](/wiki/Call_to_the_bar) at the [Middle Temple](/wiki/Middle_Temple) in 1990. He [took silk](/wiki/Queen%27s_Counsel) in 2010, was appointed a [recorder](/wiki/Recorder_(judge)) in 2011 and a deputy High Court judge in 2016. On 1 October 2020, Peel was appointed a judge of the High Court, replacing [Dame Judith Parker](/wiki/Judith_Parker) who retired, and he was assigned to the [Family Division](/wiki/Family_Division). He received the customary [knighthood](/wiki/Knight_Bachelor) in the same year. In 1993, he married Victoria Williams and together they have two sons and a daughter.
title: Robert Peel (judge)
